intro: Tanarius hexander, commonly known as the Swedish buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Tanarius hexander produces small, greenish-brown seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
